description.overall: The ASTVisitor class is designed to traverse an Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) of Python source code and extract relevant information about imports, functions, and classes. It initializes with source code, file path, and project root, and provides methods to visit different types of nodes in the AST.

parameters.description: The source code to be analyzed.

parameters.name: file_path

description.overall: The CallGraph class is designed to analyze and construct a call graph from a given Python file. It utilizes the abstract syntax tree (AST) to traverse and understand the structure of the code, identifying function definitions, calls, imports, and class definitions.

description.overall: The RepoFile class represents an individual file within a Git repository. It provides lazy loading of file content and metadata, such as file size. The class allows for analysis of file contents, such as word count, and can be converted into a dictionary format.

returns.name: content
returns.description: The decoded content of the file.

description.overall: Lazy-loads and returns the size of the file in bytes. If the size is not already loaded, it retrieves it from the Blob object.

returns.description: The size of the file in bytes.

description.overall: Analyzes the file content and returns the word count. This is an example analysis method.

returns.name: data
returns.description: A dictionary representation of the RepoFile object.

returns.description: A string representation of the RepoFile object.

description.overall: The CallResolverVisitor class is designed to traverse an Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) of Python code and resolve function calls, tracking the call relationships between different parts of the codebase. It initializes with a file path, project root, and definitions, and uses this information to analyze the AST nodes it visits. The class provides detailed insights into where and how functions are called, which can be crucial for understanding and analyzing code dependencies and structures.

init_method.description: The constructor of CallResolverVisitor initializes the object with a filepath, project_root, and definitions. It sets up several instance variables to keep track of the module path, scope, instance types, and current caller and class names. It also initializes a dictionary to store the calls made to different functions or methods.

parameters.description: The path to the file being analyzed.

parameters.name: project_root

parameters.name: definitions
parameters.description: A dictionary of definitions used for resolving calls.

description.overall: This method is invoked when a call node is encountered in the AST. It attempts to resolve the callee's pathname, and if successful, records the caller's information (file, line, caller name, and caller type) in the calls dictionary.

description.overall: This method handles assignment nodes in the AST. Specifically, it checks if the assignment involves a call to a class constructor and updates the instance types dictionary accordingly.

parameters.description: The AST node representing the assignment.

description.overall: This private method resolves the qualified name of a call based on the function node. It handles different types of function nodes, such as Name and Attribute, and uses the scope and instance types dictionaries to resolve the pathname.

parameters.name: func_node
parameters.description: The AST node representing the function being called.

returns.name: callee_pathname
returns.description: The resolved pathname of the callee, or None if resolution fails.

description.overall: The ClassDescription class is a Pydantic model designed to hold a comprehensive analysis of a class, including its purpose, constructor details, and a list of its methods.

init_method.description: The constructor initializes a ClassDescription object with four main attributes: overall, init_method, methods, and usage_context.

parameters.name: overall
parameters.description: A string describing the overall purpose of the class.

parameters.name: init_method
parameters.description: An object containing details about the class constructor.

parameters.name: methods
parameters.description: A list of objects, each detailing a method within the class.

parameters.name: usage_context
parameters.description: An object providing context about how the class is used.

usage_context.dependencies: This class does not have any external dependencies.
usage_context.instantiated_by: There is no information on where this class is instantiated.

description.overall: The ClassAnalysis class serves as the main model for representing the entire JSON schema of a class. It encapsulates essential information about the class, including its identifier, description, and any potential errors that may arise during analysis.

init_method.description: The constructor of the ClassAnalysis class initializes the object with an identifier, description, and an optional error message. It sets up the basic attributes required for class analysis.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the class.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A detailed description of the class.

parameters.name: error
parameters.description: An optional field to store any error messages encountered during analysis. Defaults to None.

usage_context.dependencies: This class does not have any external dependencies.
usage_context.instantiated_by: There is no information provided on where this class is instantiated.

description.overall: The CallInfo class represents a specific call event from the relationship analyzer. It is used in 'called_by' and 'instantiated_by' lists to provide detailed information about the call, including the file, function, mode, and line number.

init_method.description: The class is initialized with parameters for file, function, mode, and line. These parameters are used to set up the instance attributes.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The file where the call event occurs.

parameters.name: function
parameters.description: The name of the function that makes the call.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: The mode of the call, e.g., 'method', 'function', 'module'.

parameters.name: line
parameters.description: The line number where the call event occurs.

usage_context.dependencies: This class does not have any external dependencies.
usage_context.instantiated_by: This class is not instantiated by any other class or function.

description.overall: The FunctionContextInput class is a Pydantic model designed to hold structured context for analyzing a function. It captures two primary pieces of information: a list of functions or methods that the current function calls, and a list of call information about who calls the current function.

init_method.description: The class is initialized with two optional parameters: calls and called_by. The calls parameter is a list of strings representing the names of functions or methods called by the function being analyzed. The called_by parameter is a list of CallInfo objects, which contain information about the functions or methods that call the function being analyzed.

parameters.name: calls
parameters.description: A list of function or method names called by the function being analyzed.

parameters.name: called_by
parameters.description: A list of CallInfo objects containing information about the functions or methods that call the function being analyzed.

usage_context.dependencies: This class does not have any external dependencies.
usage_context.instantiated_by: This class is instantiated in two locations: the evaluation function on line 162 of evaluation.py, and the main_workflow function on line 216 of main.py.

description.overall: The FunctionAnalysisInput class is a Pydantic model designed to serve as input for generating a FunctionAnalysis object. It encapsulates necessary details such as analysis mode, identifier, source code, imports, and context for comprehensive function analysis.

init_method.description: The class is initialized with parameters defining the analysis mode, identifier, source code, imports, and context.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Specifies the mode of analysis, which must be 'function_analysis'.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the function being analyzed.

parameters.name: source_code
parameters.description: The source code of the function to be analyzed.

parameters.name: imports
parameters.description: A list of import statements relevant to the function's analysis.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Contextual information about the function, including dependencies and usage.

description.overall: The MethodContextInput class is a Pydantic model designed to hold structured context information for methods in a class. It encapsulates details such as the method identifier, calls made by the method, the methods or functions that call it, argument names, and an optional docstring.

init_method.description: The class is initialized with parameters for identifier, calls, called_by, args, and docstring. These parameters are used to set up the instance attributes.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The name of the method.

parameters.name: calls
parameters.description: A list of methods or functions called by this method.

parameters.name: called_by
parameters.description: A list of methods or functions that call this method.

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: A list of argument names for the method.

parameters.name: docstring
parameters.description: An optional docstring for the method.

description.overall: The ClassContextInput class is a Pydantic model designed to hold structured context for analyzing a class. It encapsulates dependencies, instantiation information, and method context.

init_method.description: The constructor initializes a ClassContextInput object with dependencies, instantiated_by, and method_context.

parameters.name: dependencies
parameters.description: A list of dependencies for the class.

parameters.name: instantiated_by
parameters.description: A list of CallInfo objects indicating where the class is instantiated.

parameters.name: method_context
parameters.description: A list of MethodContextInput objects providing context for methods in the class.

description.overall: The ClassAnalysisInput class is a Pydantic model designed to serve as input for generating a ClassAnalysis object. It encapsulates necessary details for class analysis, including mode, identifier, source code, imports, and context.

init_method.description: The constructor of ClassAnalysisInput initializes the object with mode, identifier, source_code, imports, and context. It sets up the required fields for class analysis input.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Specifies the mode of analysis, which must be 'class_analysis'.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The name or identifier of the class to be analyzed.

parameters.name: source_code
parameters.description: The raw source code of the class definition.

parameters.name: imports
parameters.description: A list of import statements relevant to the class.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Additional context for the class analysis, including dependencies, instantiation points, and method context.
